question: A sample of water is found to contain 5.85% (w/w) of AB (molecular mass 58.5) and 9.50% (w/w) <katex>$XY_{2}$</katex> (molecular mass 95). Assuming 80% ionisation of AB and 60% ionisation of <katex>$XY_{2}$</katex> the freezing point of water sample is: [Given: <katex>$K_{f}$</katex> for water 1.86 K kg mol-1]
explanation: Calculate total molality and van't Hoff factors.
Moles AB = 0.1, Moles XY2 = 0.1. Mass water = 0.08465 kg.
